definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: The shape of falling raindrops can be approximately treated as spheroids.
sentences.chinese: 下落雨滴的形狀可以近似地用旋轉橢球體來處理。

sentences.english: They watched the rain pit the sea with tiny craters.
sentences.chinese: 他們注視着雨滴在海上面砸出的小水窩。

sentences.english: Falling raindrops break up through hydrodynamic effects .
sentences.chinese: 下落雨滴由於流體動力作用而破碎。

sentences.english: There will be fogging, a wet windshield, raindrops and wipers.
sentences.chinese: 會有霧，溼的擋風玻璃，雨滴和雨刮。

sentences.english: Pick up bright the raindrops, or remain in the hearts of lonely.
sentences.chinese: 捧起晶亮的雨滴，留在心中的還是寂寞。

sentences.english: The unbelievable orchids are as old as time and as beautiful as rain drops.
sentences.chinese: 不可思議的蘭花，古老如歲月，精美如雨滴。

sentences.english: They never reach the ground, evaporating like a mirage while still in the air.
sentences.chinese: 雨滴不曾落到地面，在空中就如海市蜃樓般蒸發。

sentences.english: Only the rain aroused intensive click sound.
sentences.chinese: 只有雨滴激起密集的吧嗒聲。

sentences.english: Wind-driven drops of the autumn rain.
It was proved that the centre of the drop didn't overarch the water fall.
sentences.chinese: 早已證實出雨滴的中心物質並不構成降雨的真正原因。

sentences.english: When it rained, funny sounds came from the splashing raindrops on the butterbur leaf.
sentences.chinese: 下雨的時候，雨滴飛濺到款冬葉上，發出好聽的聲音。

sentences.english: They sat in embarrassed silence, watching the raindrops bruise the first flowers.
sentences.chinese: 他們陷入了尷尬的沉默，看了一會打在花朵上的雨滴。
雨滴答滴答地下個不停。

sentences.english: I stood beside the stone mortar, raised his head to look at the falling rain, bright and transparent.
sentences.chinese: 我站在石臼旁邊，仰起頭看那落下的雨滴，晶亮透剔。

sentences.english: The wind falls, the rain slides silver down the glass.
sentences.chinese: 一陣風襲來，雨滴閃爍着銀光落在草葉上。

definition: fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
Yushui or Rain Water, 2nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 19th February-5th March
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
